context: Municipal utility company planning transition to renewable energy sources

request.purpose: Invest in solar and wind energy infrastructure to achieve 50% renewable energy by 2030
request.justification: Meet regulatory requirements and reduce carbon emissions by 40%

decision_process.outcome: Clear regulatory pathway identified with available incentives worth $12M
Feasible with 60% solar, 40% wind mix achieving target capacity
20-year NPV positive with acceptable rate increase of 3.5%
Strong community support with environmental benefits outweighing concerns

business_impact.expected_outcome: Position as regional leader in sustainable energy, improved regulatory compliance, and long-term cost stability
business_impact.projected_value: $120,000,000 in avoided fuel costs over 20 years

lessons_learned: Early community engagement critical for infrastructure projects, comprehensive stakeholder analysis prevents delays
